p: Rumen fluid samples were collected through an oroesophageal tube 4 h after morning feeding at 14, 28, 42, 60, 74, and 90 d of age, and pH was assessed using a portable potentiometer (Phmetro T-1000, Tekna, Araucária, Brazil). Two aliquots of 10 mL of ruminal fluid were separated. One was acidified with 1 mL of 20% metaphosphoric acid, and the other with 2 mL of 50% sulfuric acid. These samples were stored at -20°C for further analysis of VFA and nitrogen ammonia. Nitrogen ammonia concentration was quantified using the colorimetric distillation method proposed by Chaney and Marbach [ 42]. Its absorbance was measured at 630 nm (Thermo Fisher Scientific, Madison, WI, USA) after Kjeldahl distillation with magnesium oxide and calcium chloride according to Method 920.03 [ 39]. The VFA concentrations were determined in the samples previously centrifuged at 1,800 × g for 10 min at room temperature (22–25° C) by high-performance liquid chromatography (Waters Alliance e2695 Chromatograph, Waters Technologies do Brazil LTDA, Barueri, SP, Brazil).
